user_review: Best brunch place in Mtl hands down. There are no reservation so you might have to wait for a while, but it is most definitely worth it. The food is great and the portions are huge!!

L'Avenue is one of the most highly rated and talked about brunch places in Montreal. It consistently has a long line up no matter what time or day of the week so I was fairly excited to finally try it. Our group of four had no trouble getting a table on a Monday morning when the restaurant first opened.Food 3.5/5We ordered the Saint Petersburg and Mac+Cheese Waffle. The Saint Petersburg is a smoked salmon eggs Benedict served on a latkes potato waffle instead of an English muffin. The potato pancake was okay but wasn't crispy as I hoped and instead was just a soggy hashbrown. The salad would have been nice to balance the greasy hashbrown but the lemon in the dressing was too over powering.The Mac+Cheese Waffle is a spin on the classic chicken and waffles. The fried chicken was coated in BBQ sauce that was overly sweet in my opinion and was too much to eat on its own. The mac & cheese waffle was fairly bland and was lukewarm when it was served. Service 4/5Overall I feel that L'Avenue is overhyped but would try it again if there was no line. The food portions are extremely generous and would recommend sharing a dish between a couple.

Amazing brunch place locates only 2 blocks away from Mont-Royal station. They have a great variety of different types of breakfast. Trust me you will want to order everything on the menu! Each dish comes with a fruit kebab. Everything tasted amazing and the price is good. I ordered a chorizo eggs benedict and a cup of cappuccino. The egg benedict was cooked perfectly. (The yolks were very drooly! The best indicator that it is a good eggs benedict.) The hollandaise sauce was delightful, not too overpowering. I also really liked the potatoes!! Very crispy and had tons of flavour! The cappuccino tasted like a normal cup of coffee you would get at a cafe.Overall, great food, good ambiance and awesome decor! Make sure to check out the bathrooms! There is usually a 30-minute waiting line but it is worth waiting. I highly recommend going there!Chorizo Eggs Benedict ($18.34)Cappuccino ($4.57)

Great ambience of the place and perfect for a quick lunch or coffee. They have a wonderful selection of fresh to go meals. Phenomenal coffee and all kinds of desserts and chocolates, OMG the chocolates, that's what I call an exotic selection worth checking out!

My friend and I's first time to eat here and we had no idea what to order. The menu is so overwhelming. Lot to choose from. I decided to take a Californian Egg Benedict and I didn't regret a bit. It was delicious. It has avocados and smoked salmon  which I am so happy about. The side salad was good as well that finished it as well. The interior is about street style. Above us was a motorcycle, the wall was not just plain paint but with abstract shapes and colors with touch of graffitis. My belly was so happy and thrilled. Will definitely come back!

Came around 10am on a cold Thursday with a group of 5. Pros: - Good service: our water was refilled quickly, our waitress was really friendly and attentive. Whenever we asked for something, she brought it over instantly.  - The water was really good! I don't know what it is, but I found it absolutely delicious. There's no special taste or anything. It tasted like pure, delicious water! (Or maybe I was just dehydrated?) - Really good fruit skewers: the fruit was extremely ripe and sweet - Good food, huge portions! Not much to say. The food tastes delicious and the portions are very generous. * Pro tip: get the braised ham. AMAZING! - Decent price: the whole meal cost me 25$ and it was more than enough food to cover breakfast and lunch! Cons: - Small space: it doesn't feel cramped at all inside, but there's not a lot of seating, so there was quite a bit of wait outside. - Too much food, so you feel fat afterwards? I don't really have any other cons! (They're more than happy to pack up your leftovers) Final thoughts: delicious, great place, but try to come earlier to avoid the wait.

BEST BRUNCH PLACE IVE EVER BEEN TOO!!!I'm such a huge brunch lover and my boyfriend wanted to check this place out because of their high ratings and it was the BEST thing we've ever done! If you're in Montreal, you HAVE to come here, hands down. There usually is a wait but trust me, it's so worth it. I would come back to Montreal solely for this brunch spot! The customer service here is impeccable as well. Our waiter was very attentive and gave us great rrecommendations. Even the decor here is awesome! The food: We first ordered some Hot Chocolate to warm us up from waiting outside and damn was it so so good. It even came with a piece of chocolate on the side which was such a nice touch! We also got fruit skewers which was a surprise because using anything fruit related is extra in NJ/ NY and it was complimentary, so fresh and sweet too in the middle of winter... MIND BLOWN... As the entree I got The Indecisive which was seriously so well fitted for me because I wanted a little bit of everything with someone sweet such as my Nutella French toast. My boyfriend also got the Steak and eggs which he really enjoyed. I tried some of the steak and it was really flavorful! I can't say enough about this place but it definitely became my number one brunch spot I've ever been to! 100% recommend coming here!

My first stop for food during my Montreal trip and it surely didn't disappoint! My friends and I got here a little after it opened and got seated right away. The menu includes an endless amount of options even for the pickiest eaters out there. I was drawn to the Eggs Benedict from the mouth watering pictures that I was seeing on Yelp. I was stuck between the Steak and Eggs Benedict or the Californian Benedict but ultimately went for the Californian Benedict because it included avocado. For all avocado lovers out there this is for you!The Californian Benedict was hands down one of the best Eggs Benedict I have ever had in all my brunch experiences! It was packed with avocado, a generous amount of creamy spinach, smoked salmon and hollandaise sauce. With the Benedict comes a fruit stick and a side of potatoes. The potatoes were well seasoned and crispy on the outside. Just a note that the portion size is pretty big and can be something that you can share! In terms of service, shout out to our waiter for being so patient with us while we were deciding what we wanted to order. The ambiance of the restaurant was nice but I would note that the tables are rather close to one another. Highly recommend this spot to anyone who's looking for some delicious brunch!

Not much that I need to say that hasn't already been said! This place is the WHOLE package! Food/ ambiance / drinks everything is amazing!  I don't often highly recommend places; but this place I highly recommend. Note: if you're looking for a QUIET low key place, this is NOT the place. Everyone is there to have a fabulous wine-filled time

Probably the most surreal, surprising and amazing breakfast restaurant I visited during my entire Montreal trip.Try the billionaire bacon, it's worth it.The server dared me to try and finish my entire meal, I finished everything with the exception of the hashbrowns.The service was top notch as per Montreal's standard and the environment was nice, a bit small but worth while nevertheless.Visit visit visit this place if you are in Montreal and you fancy yourself an amazing breakfast experience.

More of a chain breakfast place for the mass market with huge portions.I am not a huge fan of egg benedicts so this may be a bit biased. The poached eggs tasted too sour to me. I got the shashuka with chorizo instead of beyond meat and it was served with poached eggs (the same as egg benedict), I like the baked egg version much better. Tomatoes weren't bursting with as much flavor as the tomato from farmers market and it needs a little bit more spice. It was also a bit too watery and not dense enough. The best part of the dish was the toasted sesami bagel from st viateur with butter on top. These bagels tastes so much better toasted!They no longer serve duck benedict (not enough scale for one dish as we were told) which was disappointing for my sister.Service was great. The fresh toast was so so as well, fluffy but lacked structured at the edges. The topping was ok. Definitely big portions for what you pay. The service was great.

As a yelper from miami elite squad I'm always using Yelp to find the hot spots to eat, drink and dine in while on vacation and exploring new places. During this vacation I found myself in Montreal Canada enjoying a new country and people. My group and I had a great time here. I stumbled upon this restaurant and told my group we had to try it out. I'm so glad we did. From the walk in to the point we left we knew we made the absolute right choice! We ordered:- Damn good fried chicken sandwich - The detox smoothie - Gym dude omelette with potatoes and wheat breadOur server Leonie was nothing short of amazing. I want to take the time to share that she took her time with us in explaining the restaurants menu items and gave us some of here professional tastebud opinions on what to eat and drink. She was very nice and treated us like locals. Thank you for making us feel at home. The food was fantastic and so was the detox shake/smoothie. We will be coming back here next time in Montreal!!

Wait time: close to 1.5 hours because our group consisted of 7 people. Arrived around 11:45am and got seated by 1:15pm on a Sunday. At the end of the meal, we almost forgot about the wait time - the whole experience exceeded our expectations.My meal: the Indecisive (picture included). I asked for all Swiss cheese and they delivered. No complaints about everything else on the plate. Strawberry Nutella French toast was amazing. I wish I had room to finish everything. The rest of the table: ordered a variety of Benedict's and was highly recommended. Plan accordingly so you won't be disappointed. L'Avenue will always be a place to visit when I visit Montreal again.

Did not think it was worth the wait or the price. And I also didn't like the taste of my eggs benedict. Maybe I should have just ordered a regular eggs benny, but they seemed to have cooler toppings available so we went for those. At $18-$20 for a fruit skewer and a standard eggs benedict though, I'd opt to go elsewhere. Decor and washroom is cool though!

I went here when I was in Montreal for business last year. The ambience is epic, portion sizes are huge, food quality and service are perfect, and the washroom... unlike anything I've ever seen (make sure you go to the washroom when you eat here lol). Only down side is the line is massive if you try to eat here on a Saturday or Sunday morning, and in the winter it is cold if you are seated near to the door. Since they are so busy there are people constantly entering and exiting, and since Montreal winters are freezing the front section of the restaurant is definitely a bit chilly.
Still standing as one of my favorite breakfast/brunch spots in MTL! Never disappoints. This time, no line! Definitely a plus.

Definitely worth the wait! We got to L'Avenue around 11am, and there was a line out the door. But don't let that scare you because the line goes pretty fast. I think we waited about 20 min. Once you are in the restaurant, you are greeted by mural wall and nice décor. Even though this is a busy place, everyone is very nice and accommodating.Now onto food... We ordered sweet and savory egg benedict/ Bobby does Dallas. OMG. They were soooo good! I don't know what they did to the French toast, but it was the BEST French toast I've ever had. Also the maple syrup was definitely a good addition. Bobby does Dallas was also very tasty - it had good BBQ flavor that brought the whole dish together. If I ever go back to Montreal, I will visit this place again...for sure! Now that I am writing this review, I am craving for their awesome food.

Ok this place has such high reviews for a good reason - I'm not a huge 'going out for brunch/breakie' kind of person.. mainly because mornings and I don't match. My friend, a local in Montreal told me we had to be there for 8am for no line... excuse me?? (needless to say, we didn't make it for 8am.. we arrived probably by 8:45am and really lucked out as we didn't have a line and got sat right away)Service is spectacular!!I ordered the huevos rancheros - AMAZING! The toppings on the burrito were perfect and the avocado was really something else. It was super cheesy and yummy on the inside too. Came with a side of potatoes that were possibly the best potatoes I've ever had? Crispy, seasoned but also had a great texture. Yum!My friends ordered the eggs benny - definitely super buttery and described as the 'best hollandaise I've ever had in my entire life' - it looked mouthwatering and to die for. They had so many types of eggs benny.. jeez what a great fattening but delicious way to start the day!! The meals all come with a starter of fruit and the plates itself are HUUGE- I didn't even finish my food as I was stuffed.Oh, do yourself a favour and take a nice IG photo in the bathrooms ;)By the time we finished and left, the line went down the street outside - probably an hour long wait or so! get here early if you want your noms.

Waiting for about an hour under the rain was kind of worth it here. This place started to impress the moment we stopped by. We went here for breakfast and when we got there around 10 am, there was already a long line. We asked the staff if we needed to leave a name or just stay in the line and they were very friendly and responded while giving us an umbrella as it was raining.We tried the chorizo Benedict and the full breakfast, and they both were amazing. The side salad was great too with a hint of seaseme oil in its dressing. The dishes were served with homemade potatos and a skewer of fresh fruit. They even gave us a basket of various hot sauces when we asked for one. The restrooms are quite psychedelic too!

Place is a hip restaurant, best for breakfast/brunch. Inside the decor is flashy and energetic and the spot overall is trendy and popular. We arrived early with a group of 5. Some of us ordered eggs Benedict, others the omelette. Regardless of what you order, they give you a skewer of fruit to start with. Perhaps the eggs benedicts are what seem to be the most recommended here; the Californian I had was a combination of smoked salmon and avocado.  The eggs Benedict is heavy on the sauce so if you aren't big on that I would recommend mentioning that in the order. They feature an indecisive option that comes with savory and sweet options. The carrot pancakes are quite interesting, perhaps not as good as normal pancakes but still worth a try. The fruit smoothies were also delicious as well. Overall 4/5 for a decently well balanced breakfast experience.

Why can't more breakfast places put this on their menu?! How many times are you at breakfast and you can't decide between the pancakes or the eggs? The french toast or the hash? The indecisive: you get a lil' sweet, you get a lil' salty. Best of both worlds! We came right when they opened on Sunday morning; if you come within about 20 minutes of opening time you'll get a seat, otherwise you're likely going to have to wait until second seating (which may take a while since these breakfasts are huge and take a while to consume). The tables are very close together, I don't mind since I like to ogle other people's breakfast choices when they come out and decide whether or not I have order regret. They didn't have menus in English yet, I guess they just changed their menu up and haven't printed/created an English version. This was kind of a bummer since it makes deciding much more difficult; you can make out/guess most main dishes (pancakes=pancakes) but I had some trouble with translating the sides/toppings. My husband got the chorizo benedict; it was larger than I expected, with the hash-like topping of peppers, onions, and chorizo spilling over the edges of the english muffin and filling the plate. The hollandaise was tart and creamy, the eggs poached to perfection. It was served with a salad that was dressed with some sort of asian dressing; sounds weird but my husband seemed to enjoy the combo. I got the indecisive with dulce-de-leche french toast. It was topped with a brown sugar/pecan glaze and whipped cream and also seemed to be 'crusted' with some panko. No where near the crispy perfection of La Passe Composè's french toast, but I appreciate the effort and still happily consumed the the whole thing. It came with potatoes which were garlicky and covered in delicious thyme, the only thing that would make them better is if they were crispy instead of soft. My eggs were poached perfectly, as well, and the bacon and sausage were also done well. Service was attentive, prompt and polite. They offered us all the sauces we could ask for and will bring you out a tray of hot sauces if you want. Most of their entrees are $15-20 CAD which is incredible for the amount of food/variety of food you get. PS. Blacklight party in the bathroom. Just go.

Loved this place and ordered Uber eats today for lunch. Had a missing pulled ham($8.75). The Bobby at Brome lake had undercooked cruncky potatoes and was a bit on the bland side. The pecan French toast is burnt and greasy, it doesn't have the whipped cream topping and the pecan is so stale it tastes like it was toasted last week. Literally everything I ordered was terrible. I know it's a pandemic and it's hard on the restaurant business, but it can't explain this lack of quality.
The food was great. Staffs were well trained. It was great place for taking photos. It's worth for waiting.They also have crazy art in the restroom.

Worth the wait! It's a really small spot with limited seating so becareful coming here as a large group. We saw a group of 8 attempt to get in and it wasn't fun for them. I'd go back again if not for waiting in the line. If you want to go here, be prepared to wait outside. at 3pm on a Saturday it still took over 20 minutes of waiting for 2.The service was super quick once we got inside. The menu is pretty varied, we ended up getting their signature Steak & Eggs Benedict and California Benedict which was salmon and spinach with poached eggs. We also got a smoothie and both dishes came with Spears of fruit which was a nice touch.The food was expertly prepared and unlike anything I've had before. The steak and eggs Benedict was absolutely delicious and had the most incredible stewed sauce. It also had mushrooms that were melt in your mouth consistency.It think we ate and got out faster than the wait to get in haha

The long line you'll have to wait in outside to go to this place is worth it. My boyfriend and I split the sweet fruit French toast and steak n eggs benefits. It was mouth wateringly good. By far, the best breakfast in Montreal. The atmosphere could use a little work though.

Came here for brunch and was previously aware of the fact there would be a huge line.  There was..it's an extremely popular spot.  We thought for sure as a group of 5 we'd wait forever, but luckily a big group was just finishing up and we got their booth First, the booth can really only fit 4 comfortably, 5...pushing it.  But we were hungry so we didn't care if we got elbowed in the face lolThe brunch menu has a variety of options, plus options to make your own (this is what I chose, more on that in a moment)After reading the descriptions of the food (I'm not a heavy eater in the morning), I knew most of the dishes were not for me - for example, their omelettes are made with 4 eggs.  Too big of a portion for me!So I chose one egg (poached, hard, sorry but I don't like runny yolk) and a side of hash (yummy)! and a side of beans, and my meal came with toast.  Perfect to hit the spot in the morning!My friends ordered the omelettes.  I'm not lying when I say I've never seen omelettes that big.  It was HUGE.  Like honestly, no one can finish it.  It's the size of a 10" skillet and for sure more than 4 eggs!   It of course ended up coming home bc only 1/10th of it could be eaten lol The service is friendly, it's super busy/packed place, the decor is a funky diner style (definitely check the bathroom!)Glad I went there but I'm also glad we didn't wait more than 5 minutes in line lol

Made a long trek to try out L'Avenue, and was not blown away by their food. Maybe it was what we ordered, which was the omelette on breakfast potatoes. It was quite filling and was tasty enough, just not mind-blowing.

Annie KimYour review will be posted publicly on the web. Learn more"The best eggs benny ever!"What time we arrived/Wait time?Arrived on a Thursday at 1pm and there was a 45 minute wait. It seemed to be worth it for others to wait in the rain so we did too!Atmosphere?The atmosphere is busy and bright. Crowded seats and fast paced but there is a hanging motorcycle on the ceiling and an amazing vibe to the place. Checkout the washrooms for sure ;)Service/Staff?The staff was great. Decent and nothing over the top. Very busy so not very service oriented.Food/Menu/Pricing?The food is amazing. The mushrooms eggs Benedict I would recommend to everyone. The best I've ever had and the potatoes that come served with all the meals are sooooo flavourful with the herbs. You'll be MORE than full here. We got the fruit smoothies and those were just okay- definitely healthy which is a plus! But two can share one of those for sure.

Eggs Benedict (Saint-Ambroise): delicious! Our server was kind enough to split up our dish on to two plates without us asking since we said we were sharing. I think we ended up getting double the amount of potatoes. The meal also came with a fruit skewer for the both of us which was a nice surprise a chance for me to get my five servings of fruits in the morning. The hollandaise sauce was yum, the egg was runny, the mushrooms were creamy, and it was a pretty large benedict. Potatoes were seasoned well and they have a variety of hot sauces you can ask for if you want an extra kick besides ketchup.We added a side of Nutella French Toast to our meal and it was delicious as well. There was nutella, strawberries, and then WHIPPP CREAMMMMM! The french toast was an extra add-on. Nutella Coffee: tasty but not a strong Nutella flavor. Came with a piece of dark chocolate on the side and latte art. The eggs benedict were enough to split between two people. I wanted to come back the next day but alas time was not enough.Oh yeah, go to the bathroom. It's like a tell tale heart in there. It's weird, blue lighting, dark, and I'm not sure what is going on but there's a screen playing an animation and a large ceiling to floor mirror in front of the toilet as you sit down and see yourself but at least the sink blocks your body so you're not just awkwardly watching yourself sit on the toilet.

Lucky enough to come here on a Friday morning around 8:30am and did not have to wait at all. I've heard/read that this is typically not the case. My fiancé ordered the steak and eggs Benedict which was incredible. I had the "everything" (don't remember the exact name) breakfast which came with a ton of breakfast meats, eggs, potatoes, French toast, and pancake. We both agreed that the potatoes were some of the best we've had. Decor is awesome and the bathrooms are an experience in themself.

Really enjoyed having brunch here. There was a bit of a line/wait to get a table but honestly it moved pretty quick and the people working there were organized and great! Food was awesome. Nothing really disappointed from what we ordered at our table. They give you a fruit skewer to start. Awesome beginning to the meal. The meals are really filling. Honestly the winner for me was the pancake. So nice and fluffy and what looked like it would be diabetes in the making, was actually quite nice- very light fluffy and sauce wasn't overpowering. Bathroom- like everyone states worth a trip, very unique.

Amazing food. I got the pancakes and OMG. We went back. We all got the same meal, Again, and it was just as amazing the second time around. Wish they had this in the US. There is a line, a long line, but it's worth it. Just get there before you get H-angry.

I've never been a huge brunch person but i finally made it out to super duber popular  L'Avenue. They have a second location in St. Henri. We dropped in on a Tuesday morning (10:30am) and were seated almost immediately. Timed it perfectly because by the time we left, the line was huge. Servers are friendly and our waiter was fantastic. Constantly refilled our drinks and made sure we were well taken care of.The menu has so many options: coffees, milkshakes, exotic juices (aka. fresh smoothies), teas, freshly squeezed classics, complete breakfast, omelettes/famous eggs, pancakes/French toast, eggs benedict, sandwiches, salads and burgers.- Coffee ($1.50) - cheap and free refills- Mango, pineapple + lychee ($7.77) - it's a massive drink so be smart and share. The fruit was fresh and thick. A bit hard to suck up with the paper straws but you get used to it eventually. - The indecisive ($17.77) - 2 free range eggs with a side of fruit skewer, grilled breakfast potatoes and choice of bread (we went with brown bread). We also picked our two savoury (bacon and homemade sausage with herbs) and one sweet (pecan pie French toast). The French toast was bomb! That caramel butter on top was unbelievable. Potatoes were excellently seasoned. The egg, bacon and sausage were pretty standard.Definitely understand why this place is so popular. Come early otherwise be prepared to wait in line.

First thing first: use the restroom even if you don't have to. It's the most magical restroom I have ever seen! I was almost tempted take a selfie of myself! Seriously! Don't miss the restroom experience!Now the remaining of the review...Absolutely the best brunch I have ever had! Went there with bunch of friends on a Sunday morning and luckily we didn't have to wait. We were there by 9:15 am. By the time we left at around 10:15 there was a huge line outside!The staffs are super friendly and they went above and beyond to ensure we were having a great time! Me and my wife ordered smoked meat benedict and chicken benedict along with filtered coffee and a latte. The choice of fruits in the fruit stick was also excellent and thoughtful. The side potatoes with our dish was optimally cooked with the optimal amount of black pepper! We thoroughly enjoyed our time and if you get filtered coffee they will come and refill it when it's over. I didn't know it when I ordered so I was kinda surprised and of course happy :)

Worth the wait!On Saturday we passed this place looking for our bagel stop and there was a line outside in the cold!! I knew we wanted to eat here, but they don't take reservations. We woke up early to come prepared to wait on Sunday am. We only had two other couple in front of us and waited less than ten minutes. I was so impressed with the service and chefs. You can tell they take so much pride in their work! They are well dressed and every plate is spotless and beautiful. My husband got an eggs Benedict dish with chorizo. He ate every bite and when requested potatoes instead of salad our server brought it right away. Anytime he usually orders eggs Benedict, he usually complains they are rubbery. Not this time! I got the Indecisive with scrambled eggs, ham, bacon, and carrot cake pancakes. Perfect for me because I love savory and sweet. It came with a delicious baguette and I took half of it home. I NEVER take breakfast home.

Montréal institution for brunch! Is it worth the wait you ask???? Damn right!!! You want some of the eggs Benedict, your wish has come true! Even the bathroom is amazing. Been coming here since I was a little kid and the decor must change every couple of months. Everything is just have to come many many times to try everything on the menu

L'Avenue is a good breakfast-brunch spot serving huge portions of food for about $20/plate. I ordered Bobby Visite L'Espagne which was underwhelming because it was simply a breakfast skillet and lacked sauce. To be fair, I did not specify how I wanted the eggs cooked and they came out almost omelette like.   The menu has may options and I'm sure if I visited again I'd find something I really enjoyed.   The staff were friendly and on point with service.  The space has a colorful, urban, fun vibe. I would return and recommend others give it a go.

The best breakfast place we visited during our 4 day stay in Montreal. To me L'Avenue isn't a place you go for breakfast often (Even though we came here on back to back days.) Its an indulgent treat, with hearty portions; bold, decadent sauces and spices that should be best saved for special events. I would recommend one of the several Benedict options but everything that passed by our table looked delectable. As others have mentioned, the wait can get a bit long on the weekends, so try to go as early as possible to the opening time.

I get way too much happiness from good food. Like the closest I've been to a diet this year is erasing food searches from my browser history..LoL YELP always comes through when searching for the best places to eat. L'Avenue was definitely one of the highlights of my trip. Yes there was a long wait but the food was absolutely worth it. If you have nice friends like me then they will stand in line for you while you shop for shoes at the Aldo right across the street. I wouldn't suggest this place for large parties because space is very limited and my party of 3 skipped over several larger parties that were waiting long before us. Everything we ordered was amazing but the Caramelized Banana with Captain Morgan rum French toast was out of this world delicious. I also ordered the Indecisive (so me). You get a little of everything. While my friends had the Bobby Does Dallas and the Duck Benedict.  And after stuffing our faces until we were about to burst, we walked to Mount Royal Park to burn off all the calories. Will definitely be returning on my next trip to Montréal.

Being a large group of 15, tired from morning travels and in need of great food and awesome hospitality, I'm so happy that the hour long wait did not deter us. There was something on the menu for everyone! The sangrias were amazing and got the job done, the white was by far a favorite. I understand why people line-up for the wait. The food was amazing! While I was not really a fan of the beer battered ham because it was sweet, I did love the breakfast potatoes-- so rich and herby! The staff was incredible. They were very accommodating to our large group and she went above and beyond to answer all our questions. I don't think I have many positive experiences where big groups are handled seamlessly. We didn't wait long for the food and not one order was wrong! Thank you L'Avenue!

We came at around 8:30 and there were line already but the wait wasn't too bad. The food was amazingly tasty and we highly recommend to order French toast Benny since you can have both French toast and egg Benedict at one time if you can't decide what to order! We ordered 1 carrot pancake and the sauce was really good.

We were celebrating my dad's birthday and brought him to l'Avenue.  We got there at 9 am but there was a huge line up. We waited in line for almost an hour before getting a chance to go in.Once we were seated we were immediately given the menus and our waited asked us what we wanted to drink. We mentioned to him that it was my dad's birthday and he was so nice.We all got different types of plate, from omelettes to pancakes, and your normal american style breakfast. When our waiter came with our plates he has put a candle in my dad's waffles making it extra special.This is the type of service that really warms my heart, something taking a couple of extra minutes to make someones experience special.The ambiance was nice, it was a hip place with some great music selection. My brother was into the music and at one point he was trying to figure out the singer suddenly the waiter came by with a piece of paper. It was the bands name and title of the song. Another example of the great service and attention to detail we got.The plates were amazing, everything was great.

-25 and 50 mins wait... but once you are in there, that feels nothing!The wait and reviews are speaking to the goodness of the food here.We ordered some combo meal which was for like 20$ and it was more than enough for two of us:It had 1 fruit skewer, potatoes , 2 huge pancakes, 3 eggs and toasts. What more so you want? We ordered a side of skewer and potatoes. I also ordered their fruit shakes which one cannot afford to miss, if you are here. The coffee was pretty decent too. So the fruit- shake was like a giant bowl and so good and balanced in sweetness.The potatoes- oo lalala the most delicious house potatoes I have ever had. Well done potatoes with rosemary and parmesan seasoning and some secret flavours made them just so amazing!The pancakes were so fluffy but so soft, they just melt in the mouth! I ordered the s'mores one and they were delicious and fancy :)The meal also came with slice of cheese , which was of decent grade too.Eggs were large too.Everything was a simple regular breakfast menu item but they made each item exceptional. Thats how you do it!!!Love it.

We waited almost an hour to get into L'avenue, at least it was a nice day to be outside. We finally got a table and all 5 of us crammed around the smallest booth. The restaurant had a cool vibe and they also have a famous washroom that everyone grabs a picture of! It's all glow in the dark - pretty cool. Service was pretty good considering how busy they were - our food was all good. The stand out had to be the French toast with deluce de lece sauce. We all enjoyed our meals, but a tip to consider is come early! Keep Eating, Angela

After hearing so much about this brunch place and how wonderful it is, I knew I had to try it but there was no way I was going to wait in line for more than 15 minutes. Went with my cousin on a Monday morning around 10:15am and there was no lineup! Seating is cramped unless you're in a group of three and you get seated in a small 3 person sectional tables. Service is great, the servers are very friendly and even though they are busy they try their best to be attentive and fast. I ordered a regular breakfast to test out their renown breakfast potatoes and get a feel of their basics. I got an egg, beans, and bacon. The beans were an additional $3 (way too expensive for the quantity). The eggs was fine, bacon ok, and the potatoes were very unique and original but I wouldn't say they are my favourite. I got an oreo milkshake as well and those suckers could easily quench the thirst of a family of 4. It is HUGE. Very delicious as well. Great consistency and good ratio of oreo/vanilla ice cream taste.My cousin ordered the coconut/caramelized bananas/nutella pancakes and honestly they gave her so much food to eat I thought would collapse in a food coma at the sight. I think the prices are fair for their brunch meals because they give you so much food but they give too much food and most of it can't be kept for later. I would rather it be cheaper and they give less. One meal is enough for 2-3 people. It just seemed like such a waste. I wouldn't say I didn't like it, I just didn't love it. They have a creative menu and great service but if I had waited more than 15 minutes it wouldn't be worth it.But i'll definitely come back and try their lunch options.

A piece of advice. COME EARLY!I waited in line for a hour to get in! I arrived around 9:30AM and did not get in until 10:30AM. I thought at the time the line was long, but when I left, the line was even longer!! So go early! Avoid the line-up, and you will be VERY pleased.Again, I was on vacation and as always I decide to go have brunch. Ordered my regular, eggs Benedict. It was really good, but the potato was average. Great service thou.The only reason why I gave it a three-star and not a four was because the amount of time I had to line-up for it. I for one HATE lining up for food.

Solid experience. We got here shortly after 8am and we were seated immediately. The biggest tip here is to come early. The line becomes insanely long after 9am. We ordered a classic eggs benedict and an indecisive breakfast with sausage and ham. The eggs Benedict was super indulging! The hollandise was definitely packed with a load of butter making it amazingly creamy and flavourful. It is also complimented well with a salty pulled ham. Although the Benedict was great, the potatoes are the reason I would keep coming back. Flavoured perfectly with various spices, the potatoes give you a reason to keep eating. I think I finished my potatoes before my Benny's! My friend had the indecisive and the star of that plate is nonetheless the French toast. Made with extra thick and FRESH bread. The creme fresh is also an amazing touch as it is most fresh than sugary complimenting the sweetness of the toast. Overall, this was an amazing experience which also led to us visiting l'avenue at the other location on notre dame!
OMG on my last review I totally meant to say DUCK eggs Benedict and not the other word! LOL.

The food here is amazing. You have to wait in a crazy line, but it's worth it. I ordered the sweet savory crunchy Benedict and it was so delicious. It's a crunchy piece of French toast with ham, poached eggs, Swiss, and hollandaise. I was skeptical but I loved it. Split it if you can! There is so much food. I would highly recommend the Nutella coffee. It's something much better than just mixing Nutella in your coffee and I wish I got another cup to go. I would give them five stars if I didn't find the most disgusting hair with lint in my water. My dad also had an eyelash in his. Thinking about the hair makes me nauseous and kept me from enjoying my meal as much as I would have

We had to wait 35 minutes for a table due to this place's popularity. WORTH IT!!!! Hands down the #1 spot for brunch! To taste a lil bit of everything, we ordered the "Indecisive" with bacon, sausage, and the strawberry + nutella french toast (DROOOL) and the californica (sp?) eggs Benedict and shared it between 2 people. Plenty of food, we were very full. Perfect perfect perfect! Will come back here every time we come to Montreal! Also, make sure to check out the washrooms
Amazing brunch food. The chicken benny was SOO GOOD and the French toast was amazing as well. Been here twice and both times have been great. usually go around 2:30-3 to avoid lines.

I highly recommend this place for brunch. Everyone in our party were very satisfied with their food. I had the chorizo benedict and it was delicious. The sauce was creamy but yet light. Their breads were also fresh and tasty. I also tried their combo plate which had bacon, a sausage, pancakes and a french toast. It was all good but the french toast especially was absolutely fantastic. The staff are nice and friendly and the interior is very cool. Just make sure you have about an hour or two to stand in line if you go there on a weekend (not sure about other days of the week).

Our friends recommended L'Avenue as a must try in Montreal for brunch.LOCATION & DECOR: 4/5Located close to Mont Royal metro station, this place is pretty convenient.The decor of this place is definitely unique! It's very colourful and artistic. The only thing is that the restaurant feels very tight. I understand that the tables are close together to fit more people (as this place is extremely popular), but I was afraid of knocking someone's food/drinks on my way to my seat.FOOD: 5/5Came for the eggs benedict. They about a dozen varieties, a lot of them are vegetarian friendly. I appreciate that they all came with home fries and a fruit skewer. Both of ours were delicious. The portions were MASSIVE. Honestly it would've been the perfect amount for us if we shared one order, but we didn't want to feel rude. I only wish they had a smaller portion option so we didn't have to waste any food.Also nice touch: all of their water is watermelon infused! You can't tell by looking but you definitely taste it.SERVICE: 5/5Servers are very friendly and professional. There are French and English menus available. Even though they are extremely busy, they still take the time to ask you if you are enjoying your food.Great unique brunch place! Come here on weekdays or early on weekends to avoid lines!

My friends dragged me here after we kept striking out on places (line up after line up). This place had a small line (at 2:30pm on a FRIDAY people) ha but the little wait was worth it. The decor is so fun. The menu will have something for everyone. The portions are HUGE. Like my eggs Benedict could have fed 3 people. The flavours were delicious. And you MUST check out the bathrooms. So fun.

This is hands down my favorite brunch restaurant in the city! I've been there 3 times now and I can't get enough!! The service is amazing but make sure you either come early or call and make a reservation because it gets packed quick! Lol, the food is definitely worth the wait. P.s their French Toast is to die for!!!!

BELIEVE THE HYPE.  Once you order, they start you off with a fresh fruit skewer. The home fries that come with most orders are FANTASTIC. I can honestly say that those are the best potatoes I have ever had. They're so flavorful and addicting. The Duck Confit Benedict is absolutely amazing. The eggs are cooked perfectly, over a bed of sweet and salty duck and onions. The Beautiful Truffle is also wonderful. The sautéed mushrooms soak up all the delicious spices and oil that they are cooked in. The Nutella French Toast is crispy and soft at the same time, and just the right amount of sweet. Bobby Does Dallas is also very good if you like barbecue sauce. It is a skillet with potatoes, mushrooms, and steak tossed in barbecue sauce, topped with scrambled eggs.There are a ton of menu options from sweet to savory, and they even have the "indecisive" which allows you to have both. The prices are good, especially for the portion sizes. The plates are definitely be sharable if you aren't too hungry.The wait to get in and get your food can be a bit long, but it is well worth it. I will 100% be back the next time I find myself in Montreal.

Wow, this place was so delicious, and the portion are very reasonable and amazing. The service was excellent and the food was amazing. The atmosphere inside is so cool and very colorful. They also have terrace to sit in the outside weather. I am totally coming back

Highly recommend this place! Portions are huge and delicious and service is great. The line to be seated is incredibly long but worth the wait! I usually order one of the eggs Benedict's and I have never been disappointed. The bathroom is also unique and something everyone must check out.

Brunch was a must in my visit to Montreal and L' avenue seemed like a perfect place for it. We arrived around 930 on a Friday with no issues getting a table immediately. When we left there was a good size line outside so definitely try to come early.The interior is funky and the menu has a game show theme to it. To eat I had the wild mushroom and lardon benny and my friends ordered the indecisive and a 2 egg breakfast. We were also given a fresh fruit skewer prior to our food arriving. I am a sucker for eggs benny and l'avenue did not disappoint. The hollandaise was delicious and the eggs were poached perfectly. It was served with seasoned breakfast potatoes which were also fantastic. My friends also enjoyed their choices with no complaints. They also had mimosas with unique flavors. I tried a blueberry basil mimosa for scientific research purposes. A definite must stop in Montreal for breakfast and brunch lovers. Also check out the bathroom- definitely unique.

L'Avenue is a quirky brunch spot that claims the title of most popular brunch spot in Plateau-Mont-Royal with consistent lines on the weekend.  Fortunately, things are slightly better on the weekdays but after 10 am, the place was still packed. The decor includes numerous mannequins and a menu with photos of various Canadian celebrities and random characters hawking the brunch specialties, including French toast and pancake offerings, Eggs Benedict variations galore, as well as burgers and sandwiches.  Portions are generous and include a skewer of fruit with pineapple, strawberry, cantaloupe, and orange. A well rounded drink menu included coffee, coconut milk, mimosas, and Bloody Caesars.  Our order:I'll Take It All - $17.66. The kitchen sink of entrees that includes a pancake, French Toast, Sausage, bacon, baked beans, homemade crotons, pulled pork, pate,  and two eggs.  It's a great dish for sharing and sampling a lot of variety.  Everything was tasty including an incredibly fluffy pancake and  French toast that just tasted so good with the maple syrup. Duck Benedict - $16.92. A very Canadian variation on the Benedict with tender and savory duck confit meat combined with perfectly poached eggs, Hollandaise sauce and caramelized onions.  Very filling. The house potatoes are delicious too and they provide both mayo and ketchup for dipping. Overall, great brunch spot in the Plateau Mont Royal with friendly service, casual vibe and plentiful food for sharing.  L'Avenue accepts credit cards including Amex.

Excellent brunch. One of the best I've had in my life! This place is well worth the wait, we came here on a Tuesday morning at 10am and waited for 40 minutes for a table of 2.They have a steady flow in and out of the restaurant and even though there is a wait, you are well taken care of even while waiting in the line. The service is great, upbeat and very professional.I cannot say enough about the food. If you're a person who struggles to choose savory versus sweet at brunch, this is the place for you!!! I ordered one of the indecisive choices with the strawberry Nutella french toast. Damn! My partner ordered the truffle egg dish with a side of carrot cake pancakes. Amazingly delicious as well.Cannot wait to come back!

First stop on my first trip to Montreal. Waited outside for the place to open as I've heard amazing things. As soon as the doors open you are greeted by a full wall mural. The place is beautiful and artsy, even the bathrooms are an experience. My friends decided to order the energy smoothie and our friend and I decided to order the freshly squeezed orange juice. Both, DELICIOUS. 3 of us ordered the Nutella & Strawberry French Toast. It was very sweet but the french toast was HUGE and super fluffy. Never seen anything like it!! Plates, drinks, decor, bathroom, all colorful. Oh & how could i forget!!! - water infused with real watermelon. Everything super fresh :) This place is a must! I will be back.

Food: 7/10Atmosphere: 10/10Service: 9/10Value: 7/10As a Los Angeles native, I was satisfied, but not impressed.I ordered a Wild Mushroom and Lardon Eggs Benedict with a Peach Bellini Mimosa for brunch.  The Eggs Benedict, in terms of hollandaise, egg, and muffin, were pretty good and comparable to higher end LA brunch places.  The mushrooms were okay, I wish there was more lardon or something to substitute that salty flavor ham usually provides.  Potatoes- delicious.  Portion sizes- great.  I was actually full.  The Peach Bellini Mimosa was tasty, but it did not have a very strong peach flavor and tasted more like orange.  My mom ordered the blueberry basil one which I thought was better.The atmosphere of the restaurant is super cool.  Super hip, super trendy.  It is very loud in here, but it's comfortable.The service is great.  No complaints.

I can only describe Montreal as.... free spirited. It's a different kind of place. L'avenue pretty much embodies everything that is Montreal. It can be seen in the decor, the wait staff, and even translates to the food. If It's 8am and it's feels like You haven't eaten in days, l'avenue is here for you. What should I order you might ask. Although there are numerous ways you can go, to you I say....the Benedict! This is absolute indulgence. The duck confit in particular is perfectly executed. Pro's-portion size: very much deceiving. I almost requested a wheel barrel to wheel me out. -service: my food came out in 5 minutes flat. Beat that! -menu: sooooo many optionsConshonestly I'm not sure I can think of any....

I don't even know where to begin with this place!After landing at Montreal airport around 9:00am, my friend and I headed straight to L'Avenue for breakfast. She randomly came across it on her Google search and based on the reviews, we decided to check it out.I couldn't have chosen a better way to start off my weekend trip to Montreal! THIS PLACE IS OUTSTANDING! Like, I still don't even know where to begin. Should I discuss the amazing customer service, trippy/ eclectic bathroom, or finger/plate-licking food? I'm not sure!Let's start with the service! Based on the reviews, it mentioned that the wait would be long and the house would be packed, which I thought would mean less-than-great service. However, it was quite the opposite. We had a friendly employee come out every 10-15 minutes to let us know how long it'd be before we could enter the restaurant and be seated. Once inside, we were brought water and asked if we'd like bread and fruit as our appetizer, which we were much obliged.The menu: extensive AF! There's something on there for everybody. Vegetarian friendly, as well! After 7 minutes of flipping the pages back and forth, I decided on the "undecided" portion of the menu, which meant I could choose a savory and a sweet dish for my combo. I settled on the Whole Wheat Carrot Cake Pancakes with a Maple Syrup and Cream Cheese Sauce for my sweet, along with the Roasted Potatoes for my savory. I can't forget to mention that a side of fruit and cheddar cheese came with the entree, too! By the time my entree came out, I was half asleep at the table. On the verge of a food coma! No exaggeration. The food was outstanding. Haven't had such hearty and scrumptious pancakes like that in a while! It was such a delicious brunch!Oh, I gotta mention the bathroom. Yes--the restaurant's bathroom. It is part of the frickin experience, man! You go in there and you feel like you're in rave or interactive arcade or escape room or Japanese light show/art exhibition. It's pretty dope and funky! Nice photo op.My friend also enjoyed her time at L'Avenue. She isn't gluttonous like me, so she stopped eating after the starter and saved her entree for dinner that night. I can't wait to come back and visit this gem. Like Kathy N. said in her comment, this place is "ONE OF THE BEST." Thanks for the hospitality, L'Avenue!

This is the second location, so it's a bit less crowded. We waited outside in the freezing weather for 20 minutes during prime Saturday brunch time. Luckily, a large table opened up quickly and we were the only party of 5. We skipped the line!  The decor inside was eclectic, funky, and full of color. The restaurant was just buzzing with energy. Also, I gotta give a shout-out to the neon bathrooms!We were seated in the most comfortable booth ever and the server was so friendly. The fun menu had a million delicious options--it was almost impossible to choose! They start you off with a refreshing fruit skewer. Next, I shared the L'Indecisive and just had the creme brulee French toast. You don't get toast like that in the States! It was bruleed to a crisp on the outside but soft as a pillow within. Loved the can of pure maple syrup.The prices were great, especially for the amount of food you're getting. It was incredibly filling, but in a satisfying way. Love love love. I wish I could brunch like this back home!

The wait is usually 30-50 minutes. And what makes it worse is you're relegated to outdoors and the process consists of a hostess coming by once every 15 minutes to add new names to the paper list. This, in 2018. Absurd. But the food is worth they hype. It has a chic vibe--fun 90s music (at a good volume), healthy conversation around you, graffiti on the walls, and excellent food. I had the French toast which is made with brioche. Some opt for crazy toppings but I kept it simple. Hard to go wrong. And the smoothies are huge.

AMAZING!!!! I will forever dream about this place. Honestly.The decor is quirky and fun, something I haven't seen for a breakfast place but I loved it.Their service was amazing. We were greeted at the door and immediately taken to our seats. Our server checked on us frequently and asked if we needed condiments before we had a chance to ask for them.When you first walk in they bring you watermelon infused water - YUM! I had an orange juice which tasted very fresh, and my boyfriend had a mango/pineapple/lychee smoothie that made me wish I had ordered one.I then had the fruity breakfast. It was a huge cup of assorted fruit (melons, berries, dragon fruit and star fruit), French toast, eggs, bacon, potatoes, and toast. All of this for $15 Canadian dollars!!!I left feeling satisfied and wishing we had a place similar in the states. This place knows how to do breakfast, and you need to experience it for yourself.Side note: they have a second location that opened about a year ago, but while there, another guest said that it wasn't as good. I would travel to this location!

Honestly nothing to complain about this place because guess what... my friend and I arrived here around 8ish and there were no lines and the restaurant was still empty! I had expected there to be long lines already considering how popular this place was. Parking was a breeze to find although there was a detour right next to this restaurant, so we had to loop around but no big deal. Our waitress originally sat us in the back booths where there were no graffiti, but one of the reasons why we came here was for the cool graffiti wall so we asked her to seat us at the tables in the front of the restaurant. She was so friendly and happily fulfilled our request. My friend and I spit the smoked meat eggs benedict ($2 upcharge to have them split it into two plates each with a side of potatoes) and nutella coffees. As everybody has mentioned, it comes with a fruit skewer, which was much needed! The fruits were so fresh and delicious. Great way to start the meal. The eggs benedict was great overall but I've definitely had better hollandaise sauce as this one tasted a bit too sour for my taste. The smoked meat was very flavorful - I could eat that all day, ugh. I enjoyed the potatoes a lot as well! Coffee was amazing and strong so it was a nice touch of sweet chocolate-y goodness and much needed caffeine. Service was incredible!

Was looking to try an authentic brunch place and stumbled upon this place on Yelp. With the crazy good reviews and overwhelming responses, I knew that this was the place to go too! This place is beyond popular, an incredible hot spot! The lineup for this place stretched outside and upon our arrival, the line was looking longer than ever. We ended up waiting 40 minutes outside in the cold before tasting the best eggs benny of our lives. Worth it? Absolutely. When I was seated, I was super ready to splurge. With my group of six, we enjoyed a variety of beverages : nutella coffee, hot chocolate and the matcha latte. The latte I tried myself was delicious. The foam on top was the perfect blend of creamy and flavourful. Even their water was somewhat elevated, which was infused with watermelon! With my team of 6, 5 of us got the eggs benny : steaks and eggs, montreal smoked meat and the classic. Hands down, the CLASSIC is the way to go! The ham was the most delicious piece of meat i've ever tried. The montreal meat was good as well but I didn't like the seed-like sauce on top. My friends enjoyed their steak and chorizo eggs benny's as well. Each dish comes with potatoes and those were extremely flavourful and delicious! My vegetarian friend didn't have many options to choose from which was the only downside to this restaurant. She ended up getting the undecided with the carrot pancakes and those were extremely sweet and tasted like cake with icing!
Very yummy... many options.... big portions... freshLove the free fruit skewer before your food comes out
Perfect brunch spot! We're from LA where sunday brunch is a weekly event, this place definitely competes. One of our favorite spots in Montreal. The lines are long so expect to wait 30mins at least!

So worth the 1 hour plus wait! Where do I start?! Let's start with the music. The restaurant is so cool and hip. It's definitely an Instagram worthy place if that's your thing. All of the staff is young and vibrant. Our waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu and extremely patient with us as we were overwhelmed with the amazing menu. Every single thing that we ate was SPOT ON! Letting our waitress know that we were out of town, she gave us a list of amazing places to try out during our stay. She nailed it! Definitely sneak off to the restrooms if you can. It's just going to blow your mind. Without a doubt this is one the places that I have to go to every time that I'm in Montreal.

The best breakfast place in Montreal. I would definitely travel to Montreal to just to eat here. Montreal is a city with good restaurants and this place stands top among them. I went multiple times during my stay in Montreal. French toast is the best and it's the best I have ever had. The eggs Benedict is to die for. Their hollandaise sauce is too amazing. I would say this is a must try place to eat. The staff are also friendly. The only downside is the line during weekends. Sometimes you have to wait 1 hr to have your meal. But I would say it's worth it.

An AMAZING brunch spot and super reasonably priced. It is definitely a bit of a wait but they have a great aesthetic, friendly service and most importantly delish food. I got the indecisive which should really be available at all restaurants for people like me who can't seem to choose just one thing. I got the carrot cake pancakes, two poached eggs, sausage, bacon, home fries, a fruit skewer and a bagel....all for what, $18?!? If that's not a steal idk what is.

I've gone to L'avenue many times and I have to say, it's worth the wait every single time! Don't be surprised if you see a line up, it has become the norm and to be honest ... the food and service  are so good that I don't mind it! They have a vestibule and they've made some space inside to make the wait a little more bearable in the winter time! My Favourite drinks are the Matcha Latte and Moka! You always get an entree of fruit brochette and their water is watermelon infused! Yum! I highly recommend the beautiful truffle and the breakfast burrito , for a little extra ($4,50) you can add steak in the burrito and it is AMAZING! The ambiance is great, the music is a little loud at times but not unbearable and the decor is very edgy and different! A must brunch spot in Montreal!

There was just ALWAYS a lineup and there definitely be a reason people love it so much!This is my second time here, and the food is just even better than the time I had it four years ago! Those L'avenue potatoes are on point! The serving size is A+ I ended up having that as my only meal for the day and wasn't feeling hungry at all after the big brunch!You can also see the menu was designed with cautious and care, you could even see that there are some thoughts put in the order of the fruit skewers! Definitely a must try in Montreal. The service was fantastic too! Everything was just amazing, I think nothing could really compete with the food I had here! Good job guys!

Okay, the bathroom here is a work of art!! 10/10 would return to photograph the bathroom. I'm kidding, but not really.And of course, the food is awesome too. Huge portions, and a customizable menu. For a party of three people, we ordered two dishes, which was more than enough. We got the indecisive (with carrot cake pancakes, roasted potatoes, bacon, scrambled eggs, and bread) and the shakshuka (a tomato dish with poached eggs).If you're like me, and want an excuse to eat CAKE FOR BREAKFAST, try the carrot cake pancakes! They're deliciously spiced, and you can tell yourself you're being healthy because they're made with whole wheat flour. Not normally a cream cheese gal, but the maple cream cheese frosting on the pancakes it to-die-for. Just beware they're pretty sweet.The Shakshuka was meh. Tasted a lot like marinara pasta sauce with veggies and egg. Not very flavorful. Each order comes with a fruit kebab, and you also get yummy fruit-infused water. My friend ordered their exotic strawberry juice, which ended up being very thick, like a smoothie.This place is popular, and thankfully we only had to wait ~15 minutes for a table. The atmosphere is casual, hip, and bustling. If I return to Montreal, this place is definitely on my list of brunch places (along with Sparrow!).

Be prepared for a long wait and hope it's not raining!This spot was recommended by some friends for breakfast/brunch. I would say the wait is a good 45min-1hr. Once you get through that painful experience, the real good stuff begins.  The service is pretty quick and friendly.The food portions are insane. Let me say this once, I highly recommend you share dishes, do NOT order more than one dish per person, you will go into a coma.You can get a bunch of different pancake and egg dishes. The pancakes with bananas and dulce de leche are amazing! They have a bunch of variations, but be prepared to take a nap after all that food.If you get a chance, check out the bathrooms. they have a funky decor, won't say more  as it would spoil it.

Fancy breakfast to say the least and well worth it! As we left the line was outside and down the street!! I usually don't like paying a lot for eggs and toast but this was so much more then that! Delicious breakfast potatoes and the Montreal bagel!Delicious beer braised ham and herb house made sausage! Fruit was very ripe and delicious especially strawberries in the Nutella French toast! This seems like a common theme in Montreal but the service was stellar here. Great food & great service!!!

I went with two friends for breakfast. They sat us at a 4-top right next to the bathroom. It seemed to be the last available table. The longer we sat there the more we could smell the bathroom:( Luckily, a booth opened up nearby and they kindly moved us. Honestly, they shouldn't seat anyone there.I liked my breakfast. My friends looooved theirs. I think it was the spinach on the California benny that I didn't love. It wasn't true creamed spinach. I think i would have preferred steamed or plain sauteed spinach. When we left there was a pretty long line! So get there early!

Tourist or montrealers, you HAVE to give it a try at least once. SUPER Delicious although I was already full at 2 bites. I took Matcha-Vanilla milkshake and a poached egg mushroom plate. The milkshake doesnt have much matcha flavor(they only sprinkle a bit of matcha on top of the shake) so I was a bit deceived, because it only tasted like liquid ice cream, I wish there was more matcha flavor(8$). 2 people couldnt finish the milkshake it was too much even if half of it was whipped cream The plate I took was super creamy but it was good. Very cheesy. Took it home and my bf turn the leftovers into pasta (DELICIOUS!!). There is so many option I want to try everything. Very close to the metro. When I went I was very lucky to not have to wait a long time because I know there is always a line. AND we got the booth which i'm very excited! I don't know if thats how the hostess roll but when we were waiting in line (inside) the hostess told us to wait outside. I understand, but he should have asked politely (it sounded like he was kicking us out) and it was super duper cold that day so not a good start, at least we were satisfied at the end! The waiters and waitress are super professional and I can see that they know what theyre doing.

I was looking for a brunch place on yelp and of course, L'Avenue was the first place that popped up. After reading a couple reviews, I decided to try it despite all the comments about the long wait time and I'm so glad I did!Yes, the wait was long. I think I waited about 45-50 minutes. The menu has a variety of choices of sweet and savoury foods, or even both for the indecisive (like myself)! You get the best of both worlds :). I got scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, and Nutella French Toast. Everything was delicious; so full of flavour - including the watermelon infused water! The portions were huge and you can definitely share with a friend. Even the drinks were oversized!The servers were friendly and the prices are very reasonable. I can't wait to go back to Montreal so I can have brunch here again! I would highly recommend this place. And check out the bathroom!
I found this the morning I arrived in Montreal.  I was surprised to find a line out the door even at 10am.  I waited 20 minutes and the food was definitely worth it.  I ate two main dishes.

Hands down the best brunch place in Montreal! L'Avenue has everything! My favourite thing about this brunch place is their sweet and savoury plate (the indecisive) because I can never decide what to get. The dishes are priced from $15-$20 but the portion size is pretty big so you should be full from breakfast to lunch with no snacks until dinner (or even no dinner at all). I highly recommend getting the braised ham (it's like pulled pork) and the sausage. For the indecisive, I recommend getting the carrot cake pancakes. Their eggs benedict is also very good. I usually get the eggs benedict if I don't get the indecisive. Must try! Beware of the 30-45 minute wait on the weekends if you go from 9:30-12pm.

Location/ServiceOne of a recommended restaurant to visit in Montreal. It looks a bit small on the outside, but inside has sufficient tables to serve at least 50-60 people. Street parking is available around the lot. It is a very busy restaurant - so make sure you either come early or make a reservation ahead of time if possible!Inside decor was very homey. There a lot of different colours that brings out a nice vibe. The main attraction would definitely be the washroom. It's glow in the dark, with a lot of graffiti and interesting drawings. Be sure to check it out while you're there!Service - really loved our waitress. She was so nice, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu items. I asked a lot of questions and she was able to answer them all, gave recommendations and often check on us to make sure we're okay.FoodDrink - I ordered the Nutella Coffee, which by its name it's literally coffee with Nutella. You have to stir the cup often cause the Nutella tends to stick to the bottom. But it's like a regular chocolate mocha to me, but the hazelnut brings a different taste to it.Food - ordered the Bobby Does Dallas. It's 3 scrambled eggs with cheddar cheese, topped with black angus steak, mushrooms, sauteed onions and BBQ sauce. Did I say it also came with a side of potatoes? Just listing out the items was a mouthful. The portion were huge - definitely able to be shared. I really liked the scrambled eggs, very fluffy. The steak was cooked to the right level, complimenting well with the BBQ sauce. BBQ sauce is a no fail - it may be a little bit on the sweeter side, that's why I thought having the potatoes there helped balanced it out.Tip - the order comes with a complimentary stick of fruit (the healthier stuff) and a choice of bread, which I choose baguette.Overall, very nice experience here at L'Avenue. Everything was nicely done, staff were great and a vibrant atmosphere. Would definitely come back again when I'm in town.

Big portions for the price!Friendly staff and good music.I didn't really appreciate the lighting in the bathrooms but we're not there for that ahah.I'd appreciate a bit more "healthy" options but overall, lovely place!

We first got there and there was a line outside. After leaving we realized why there was a line, this place is absolutely AMAZING. I would do the line 10 times over. The food was fresh, the waitress was super attentive. Answered all of our questions, gave suggestions. We had the white sangria, it was LIFE. Would deff recommend. If I ever come to Canada again, this would be the first place I come to. Also there's a liquor store a few stores up from there.

The best breakfast of our trip! Worth the wait in line! I recommend coming as no more than 4 people, and as 2 people, the line moved pretty quick. I wanted to go back for more. I like the fruit skewer that arrives like an appy. It's a nice touch. Duck confit eggs Benedict - yum. It has carmelized onion so I needed to add a hit of salt to balance it out, and then it was great. Poached eggs were perfect. The potatoes are perfectly seasoned. Big portioned. The menu is creative. Service was amazing from the gentleman that was our server, I wish I knew his name to give him props (clean cut young man, brown hair, thin, of average height). It's so busy there and the servers are running around. But every time he was with us, he was super cordial, answering questions, and never appearing to be in a rush, interactive. I was really impressed and he's 5 stars for sure!

As a New Yorker with access to a million + 1 restaurants, L'avenue will always be my favorite brunch spot and holds a special place in my heart.My group of 6 had to wait 1.5 hours on a Saturday to get a table, as there are no reservations. I've never had to wait more than 30 minutes for a restaurant in NYC so I said "this shit better be worth it", and boy was it! We got in and had delicious fruit smoothies that are served in margarita glasses with cute umbrellas.I had the French toast drizzles with jack Daniel sauce, coconut flakes, bananas, and caramel.  I think about that dish sometimes when I feel depressed. It was the best French toast I've had in my life. Others in my table had the steak and potatoes and I basically ate half their food for them because it was so good. The portions are hugeeee and the food is cheap! (Less than $20 an entree).1 year later and my friends and I still talk about L'avenue until today, and say we'd take a flight out to Montreal just for this restaurant. It's just that worth it.
Love, love, love this place!!!! Delicious. The wait is longggggg but sooooo worth the wait! I loved this place. The service can improve a bit but it's ok. Def recommend this place if your in town

We stopped here to grab breakfast before heading out to Quebec City and it definitely did not disappoint. The food was great and the portion was way more than enough for one person. Keep in mind, if you are planning on visiting on the weekend, you'll have to be up for long lines and limited parking spaces.
Food is average, and it's too crowded and anticipate a waiting time. We have so many other brunch places in Montreal that I would prioritize

Came here on a recommendation by a friend during my visit to Montreal. Showed up to a long line on a Friday at 11AM - a good indicator of how fantastic this place is. Despite the line, we got in within 20 minutes. The inside is eclectic, packed, and fast-paced. All the waitstaff are dressed in white dress shirts and ties, chefs too. It's inviting, and despite the rush and commotion, still very easy to chat with your table.The menu has a variety of sweet and savoury options, all with unique twists on brunch. Be warned - the portion sizes are massive. Regardless of what you order, they bring a fruit skewer as an appetizer. They have a variety of eggs benedict to choose from, as well as simpler menu offerings such as eggs and bacon. They also have a variety of drinks, from mimosas, to refillable coffee, to boozy espresso beverages.Overall, this place is fun and has a fantastic spin on brunch. I'd highly recommend braving the line, you won't regret it.Environment 5/5, food 5/5, value 5/5

My friend and I were visiting Montreal for the weekend and were told this is the place to have brunch in Montreal. When we arrived to the restaurant there was a huge line up. We had gone on a Sunday. We decided to join the line thinking it would move quickly as the waiter that took down our names said it would be 20 to 30 minutes. The line actually moved much slower than we thought it would. We waited for over an hour before we got a table. It was chilly outside so the wait felt much longer. It would of been nice if they handed out some hot beverages to everyone in line. I've seen other restaurants do this before.   The inside of the restaurant has a nice vibe. There was a motorcycle hanging from the ceiling that was pretty cool. My friend and I order the Mexican style meal to share. The portion was big enough for two. The food was amazing. Had a lot of flavour. Definitely one of the best brunches I've ever had. Every meal comes with some fresh fruit so that was nice. Overall the food at this place was great and I'm glad we checked it out even though we had to wait in line for a while.

The wait here was over an hour which I was okay to do given the good reviews. However, I was disappointed by the food. I had the sweet savoury crunchy Benedict which just had too much going on. I'm usually a big fan of a sweet salty mix, but was not impressed.

Boo Boo and I came here for breakfast on a Friday. We were lucky to get a table without having to wait. There was a huge line as after we finished. I got a cappuccino and Boo Boo got a bowl of latte to start. Then we I order the indecisive with bacon, sausage, carrot cake, bagel and eggs over easy with potatoes. Boo Boo got the egg Benedict with mushroom, onions I don't know the name..... I guess every entree comes with a fruit skewer to wet your appetite. Overall, the food was tasty and portion was huge. However, it's like $20 for breakfast per person. Kinda on high end.The bathroom is cool yet intimating.Credit card accepted.  A couple blocks for the mont royal station (orange line subway).

Was super lucky to get in for brunch on a Thursday morning with our family of 5 without having to wait. As we were seated, we could already see a line forming outside.Atmosphere is very cool with a combination feel of an old school diner with a modern twist. It is not the most spacious place but our 2 adult and 3 young children party was able to fit in one U-shaped booth without issue.Portion sizes were huge, especially the plate of pancakes that we ordered for two of our kids to share. In the end, both kids could not finish it. I ordered the "I'll Take It All" and it was a perfect way to sample a variety of their breakfast items. Food was very tasty and definitely one of the better brunch places I've tried. Even their water is infused with a hint of watermelon flavour! Will definitely be coming again.

Great experience! I can easily say this was the best place I've ever had a brunch. We were waiting on the line around 30-40 min. It was really cold but gosh after try the food I literally can say totally worth to wait. You better be super hungry when you go there.They start with plate of fruits . They serve one of the best coffee  . Try the milkshake but in a same time remember you have too many food and milk shake is huge :)The food was simply amazing. I wish I live in Montreal and go there every Sunday :) their French toast was one of the best. I loved the food  the waiter was so nice and friendly. It is a pricy place but I think totally worth it ;)

My friends and I decided to try this place after reading great reviews. When we showed up, there was a line of 10-15 people around mid day on Sunday. Needless to say it took us a while to be seated. Once we were inside, our waitress greeted us with a smile and menus. We were able to place our orders quickly.Overall the service was great, but the wait kind of sapped our energy. The food was B+. Excellent portions and funny waiters.I got the Indecisive. I chose bacon, beer-braised ham, and carrot cake pancakes.
Very nice ambiance. Food is amazing- great portions! This is why we came back! The indecisive is amazing.  The French toast is huge! I'm 203lbs and this meal is served in abundance.... YUM

L'Avenue was a fantastic start to my day! My husband and I came in for brunch and had a bit of a wait, but the wait was worth it. I got the youth smoothie and my husband and I shared their can't decide plate. So glad we shared because it was a huge portion of French toast, Sunnyside eggs, 2 meats, potatoes, and a baguette. It was all on point!

Come here early because there will be a line outside the restaurant. But the food is well worth the wait. Their potato's are so addictive, I could eat an entire plate by itself! Their egg Benedicts are a must try. Best I've had, I've been here twice and each time the meal was amazing. Worth the wait.

Really liked this place! The wait on a Sunday morning (our party of four arrived at about 8:45am) was approximately 20 minutes. It was beautiful out so we didn't mind...totally worth it! Decor and ambience are really hip and trendy. Great menu selection-some cool looking drinks and smoothies! I had an almond milk cappuccino-not bad. Every order starts off with fruit on a skewer-nice touch!Portions are huge. The omelettes are full and round! Not a half-moon as they frequently are! I ordered The Beautiful Truffle-covered in mushrooms!!!! Delicious! My husband ordered The Fruity Breakfast and it was served with the best assortment of fruit, including star & dragon fruit. Service was friendly and fast! Montreal has done great breakfast spots and this is definitely one of them! Can't wait till come back!

I LOVE this place. Worth the wait and worth the hype. I came around 9:15 and ended up waiting about half an hour. I didn't mind because the food was so good and I found that the line was moving pretty well. My friends and I enjoyed different things, but overall we liked everything we ate. It is such a popular place, which makes sense, since everything is so delicious. The prices average around $18, but the portions are quite large. We all left stuffed!

Waited less than one hour in line.Food: Had the duck benedict served with breakfast potatoes and fresh fruit. Taste of the duck was okay, I was not accustomed to the caramelised onions that it was cooked with. The poached eggs with grained mustard and hollandaise sauce was on point. The breakfast potatoes (slightly fried?) were addicting, I do not know what combination of herbs and spices they seasoned them with, you can't stop eating them!Service & atmosphere: Happy-vibe, crowded, loud. I did not know about the washroom before entering, it is very psychedelic inside with the glow in the dark graffiti art (so bring your phone inside!). Near the washroom is a clear water container with sliced watermelons inside, makes the drinking water look aesthetic. I particularly liked the rotating giant maple syrup can.Price: A bit expensive but this place knows their value.

Wow - YUM! We arrived on the morning of August 11th a few minutes before 10am and I was slightly discouraged that there was already a line outside. Most of the people waiting in line were groups of six or more so our wait was 15 minutes for a table for two. I heard the wait for larger parties towards the back of the line was over an hour.The inside vibe is "trendy" and "hip" with ridiculously huge portions of food sitting in front of people struggling to conquer their entrée.
